name: Emmy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
5 days ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Cute and comfortable place with a beautiful nature view. A peaceful and private escape, only a 15 minute drive to the beach and local shops, with cute farm stands selling fresh produce along the way. This place had everything we needed and wanted for a weekend getaway. A lovely place to grill and sit outside. The bed, sofa, and recliner chairs were all super comfortable. The kitchen was well supplied and the bathroom was spacious and clean. The hosts included nice details throughout including a chess board and drinks for sale in a fridge in the connected barn.

name: Dori
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
2 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Great place to stay!!!
I don’t even know where to start.
I adore that the connecting door to the house locks from the guest side, added security always feels good!
The details the host family thought of are AMAZING. Down to the settings on the Roku TV ( you input your checkout date and it automatically erases your streaming data on that date)
The towels are so clean. I’ve never been at an air bnb that I KNOW cleans their towels correctly.
The water pressure in the shower is astounding. A true treat.
As someone with a family member with special needs, i noticed the accessibility additions to the bathroom almost immediately. The weight bearing bars and plentiful room and tiled in seat were an amazing touch for any traveling families who may have wheelchair users or anyone with other mobility aids.
This is a lovely stay for anyone who is looking for a clean, quaint spot close to Virginia Beach with all of the essentials. Amazing stay.

review_text: One of the best AirBnbs I've stayed at over the past ten years. It was so well-stocked, pristine, and well-ventilated that it seemed like I was the first person who had ever spent the night there. The bed and furnishings were very comfortable. There was plenty on hand in terms of coffee supplies, cookware, toiletries, cleaning products, linens, and household accessories like an iron and lint roller. If I had scheduled time to go to the beach, they also supplied towels, boogie boards, and a picnic basket! The owners live on the other side of the wall, but I felt perfectly at home and private. Would definitely recommend.

Pack your clothes and toothbrush- that’s all you will need when visiting this place. I knew we were in for a treat when we pulled up and saw a drying area outside for beach items.
Norman has thought of everything. The pictures do not show how spacious this place really is. The bathroom feels like a spa, the bed and pullout couch are super comfortable and the place is stocked with everything you need. I mean everything- even beach towels and boogie boards. There are helpful notes everywhere indicating what switches control which items. And the place was immaculate.
Fantastic location in a very quiet area. This will be the first place I check when I am in the area.

Our son was 6 months old last year, thus 18 months this year and we loved the games, space in the master bedroom for the crib, and the highchair! We loaded him up in the provided wagon and walked the 2 minutes across the street to the beach. The place is clean and has everything you might need! Jason is a great host and easy to get ahold of if need be. He helped us find fresh seafood for our dinner and responds quickly. The 2 parking spots are clutch at well! We’ll be back!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The unit itself is very beautiful, and situated close by the beach. It was very spacious and comfortable, and could easily sleep more guests than we had (4 total). Some slight issues with bugs on the first day, but no major problems after that. Had a stranger attempt to enter the back door in the middle of our first night there, which was a little scary, but possibly just a mistake from someone at the wrong home. Would have loved to take advantage of the home’s other offerings (beach gear, bikes, grill) on our visit, but the weather was uncooperative. A severe storm (with nearby tornado) knocked out power for several hours on our final evening, and unfortunately there were no emergency supplies (flashlights, lanterns or candles/matches) in the unit, so we had to make due with our phones in the dark. Overall, it was a decent stay in a really lovely place. As someone who lives in a “smart home”, I loved the high-tech touches.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was a nice place to stay in Virginia Beach's quiet North End, away from the boardwalk crowds. The house was comfortable for three people, and the neighbors we met were pleasant. We didn't have any problems requiring Jason's attention during our stay. We were happy to discover that it's possible to bike along the Atlantic Avenue access road/bike path, then cross over almost seamlessly to the boardwalk bike path. We also discovered a nice bike path into First Landing State Park off of Atlantic at 64th Street. The ocean beach was a short walk away, but we also enjoyed the bay beach at First Landing State Park. For dining, we ventured twice to Tautog's, our VB favorite, and found it to be just as good as we remembered. All in all, we had a very nice time!

There is more privacy as this spot is located away from the hustle and bustle of the large crowds, but just a 10 minute drive away from 21st and Atlantic Ave. and all the major restaurants located on the boardwalk and other great places to eat on Laskin Rd. I would definitely recommend this place. The house was clean and offered tons of space for comfort and relaxation. Loved the fact that there were no keys to pick up as the home offered up an electronic locking system where you put in a code to open the door. No more lost keys!! Cable, ceiling fans, three televisions, and 2.5 bathrooms to make sure everyone has that opportunity to use the facilities when needed. I'll definitely look for this place when I'm planning my next trip to VA. Beach.

Front game room can get a little noise from neighbors - but overall you can’t beat the value of this place. Fully equipped kitchen. Nice deck sitting spot. Easy beach access. TVs everywhere. Comfortable and plenty of space. Would stay again in a minute! Great communication from owner.

A friendly tip: bring a few cozy throw blankets with you for the living room areas - there is appropriate bedding on the beds, but the downstairs couches can be chilly when cozying up to play games or watch tv in the evenings.
Appreciate the prompt and thorough communication of the host. He even offered to allow us an early check-in. Great experience working with him.
Thanks again for a great first trip to VA Beach!

My family LOVED their beds and slept so well. There were also so many unexpected extra amenities and large beautiful spaces that our 6 person family could be together.
As a host, Gus was incredible! He responded in 5 minutes! He allowed us to do an early check in and a very late check out so that we could work at the house the last day.

Even coffee for the coffee maker. I’ve never had a host ensure that you have all that you need. He has a book of restaurant recommendations which was so helpful. review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Gus's place. The house is beautifully decorated, clean and in a lovely location - just a short walk to the quiet, gorgeous beach! The beds are comfy, the bathrooms are spotless, and the kitchen is well equipped. The large garage was ideal for storing our beach items and bikes. We biked to the boardwalk, went to nearby First Landing State Park, and found plenty of great spots to eat. We were a bit disappointed about the rooftop deck, though, as it did not live up to the pictures and there was no mention of the tricky spiral staircase. Nevertheless, we did manage to venture up there one evening to play games and take in the stunning sunset. Overall, a fabulous stay! Would definitely recommend it to friends. Thank you, Gus, for sharing your beachside home.

name: Christopher
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: There may be equally as excellent places to stay in VA Beach, but there are surely none better than Gus's! We were able to check-in as early as we wanted which gave us basically another whole day in VA Beach. There is absolutely zero to complain about. The house seems as if it was just built. The kitchen is beautiful with top of the line appliances. The microwave slides in and out of the cabinet which my 5 yr old loved. The master bedroom is huge! The deck on the roof has an amazing view. The master bathtub you can just about swim in. Guest rooms & bathrooms were beautifiul. Every single room was spotless. Famiily room was very big & had a fireplace. As soon as you walk in there's a huge closet for your beach gear. Sky light in the guest bathroom was really a nice touch. A short 30 second walk to the beach and the beach was beautiful and not crowded. Gus answered any & all questions within minutes. I cannot say enough about this house and Gus. We cannot wait to go back & stay again!

No need to take pics for this review. It literally looks AS described in the app. Just like described, the name of this home is nothing less than immaculate. My parents, my husband, my two yr old and I truly enjoyed staying here.
Beach access was ideal! We came during the off season so we had the beach to ourselves and the traffic outside the house was minimal.
Gus was quick to respond! We had a hiccup with my daughter locking the bathroom door and he was super helpful, and stayed in contact until the issue was resolved!
My only complaint would be that I can’t gatekeep this house and I can see it getting booked over and over again! I know I will look forward to trying to vacation here in the future!

Also, a super short walk to the beach which is lovely. Gus provides some beach chairs, boogie boards and one cruiser bike.
We stayed a week with three of our adult kids and had a happy memorable vacation. No one was ready to leave when the time came!

review_text:
We felt we brought home with us. Very cozy, comfortable. Nice furniture
Living RM:
LG, plenty of seating( 2 comfy sofas and a leather chair)
a SM table with 2 chairs for eating.
LG picture window looking out over the golf course . Private patio out back
Microwave, single coffee maker and a standard coffee maker with plenty of coffee, SM frig ,
Knives, spoons, forks provided with a couple SM plates.
LG TV , cable channels provided. Not sure if streaming available as it was not something we were in need of.
LG bedroom , comfy bed, Although we did not use it there is a TV in the bedroom.
Loved the bathroom's LG shower and the tile work . bathroom is SM however it is all we needed.
Quality bath towels
Cozy front porch.
2 Beach bikes. Walk across the St, thru church parking lot, 2 more st crosswalks and you are on the boardwalk/beach. So easy to walk, bike to boardwalk/ beautiful beach , restaurants.
Bring a book/relax
We will return

name: Angela
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Pretty place with nice view of golf course, within walking distance of Cavalier. Location is convenient to VB and Norfolk. Newport News was an hour drive due to tunnel traffic.
We used both beds and they were comfortable. Unit is very cool, with good A/C and plenty of extra linens to keep you warm. Jet noise was minimal here, and seemed to end over weekend. Didn’t use the bikes but there were one male, one female, which is good to know. Also there is a five gallon water dispenser, which was very helpful!
The only real downside is the bathroom size, which is on the small side; and the hot water takes awhile to reach you, but once it does you’re fine.
Paul was great host, very responsive and quick to address any needs or questions.

There was coffee for the mornings, a mini-fridge, cups, glasses, utensils, and a microwave...just what we needed while on vacation. The Murphy bed, bedding and size of the bedroom were quite comfortable, and the remodeled bathroom with huge shower was great. It's a quick walk to the beach and boardwalk, too. rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Paul is a friendly and warm host!..always quick to respond and kindly offered suggestions where to eat. We took him up on eating at The Atlantic on Pacific….excellent, especially the raw oysters, homemade cornbread and Asian dumplings. Paul’s place is within blocks of the “must-see” Cavalier Hotel. Brunch on the garden terrace was perfect. Part of the Cavalier Resort is the unique Orion rooftop restaurant which specializes in Asian-fusion cuisine and handcrafted cocktails. Paul’s studio apartment is very comfortable, immaculate, spacious, and tastefully appointed. The walk-in shower, with it’s beautiful tiles, is a good size. Paul kindly said we could park our car at the villa while we waited for check-in. He kindly texted me when the studio was ready for an earlier check-in. Loved we had a coffee maker for mornings, and small refrigerator for snacks, and drinks. Nice touch was a television in the living room, and one in the bedroom. The WiFi was strong. We used the complimentary bikes to ride the 3-mile length of the Virginia Beach boardwalk. I would recommend Paul’s place, and hope to take advantage of his lovely villa studio in the future. Paul will not disappoint.

We walked to the Cavalier in 5 minutes, we walked to the boardwalk/beach in 10 minutes and we used the beach cruisers three days in a row. They were probably the highlight of our stay, I hadn’t been on a bike in forever! Paul is so friendly, we got to chat for a few minutes and he also checked in with us through message a couple of times to make sure we had everything we needed. We didn’t hear any noise from the other side of the house our whole stay. It felt very private. If you want a very clean, relaxed place to hang out that’s still close to everything and owned by a good person then stay here!!

rating_info:

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Paul’s Villa is a charming place to relax at the end of a busy day. It is convenient to all the activities that Virginia Beach has to offer yet it is nestled in a serene location that offers verandas to unwind on with golf course views. Paul was an extremely responsive host and obviously takes pride in making sure your visit goes smoothly and that the Villa has what you need for a comfortable stay. I loved having bikes to cruise around town on since I did not rent a car. He even provided beach towels for those who are traveling light! There were plenty of towels and comfortable linens. I appreciated the extra fans for those of us who are “hot” sleepers! Great water pressure in the shower is always a bonus! I truly felt pampered. Paul reached out to me on my final day to offer me a late check out when he realized that my flight was late in the evening. He had a cancellation that day and simply thought I might need some extra time with my family. The fact that he would do that speaks volumes to the type of host/person you will be working with.

review_text: We had a lovely stay. It was a rainy winter weekend, and thanks to the fireplace the living room was the perfect relaxing spot. We didn't walk much given the weather; it was really conveniently located for the errands we ran by car. Our Uber Eats delivery driver also found it easily. We don't usually cook on vacation, so the microwave, mini-fridge, coffee pot, and water cooler were all that we needed; Paul had a few dishes/glasses/cutlery available to use. The bed was comfortable and had plenty of blankets so you could adjust to your preference. If you're really tall, the bathroom/shower might be a little cramped, but at 5'10" it was fine for me and my spouse. Paul was also quick to answer questions. I would definitely stay there again.

review_text: Fantastic place to stay. Just a couple blocks from the beach, but quiet and charming. We loved both patios, especially the covered porch during a rainstorm. Paul had amazing recommendations for the area, and his classic bikes were such a blast to ride and explore the boardwalk and First Landing State Park. The place is right around the corner from the Green Cat - acai bowls, smoothies, toast, etc, perfect for our (mostly) vegan lifestyle. All in all, a quiet, relaxing way to visit an otherwise touristy/crowded area. Only thing that would have made it better would have been a kitchen; also, like the description says, there is some noise transference between the shared wall with the main house. Otherwise, everything was great. Thanks, Paul!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Very nice stay and would book this place again if visiting Virginia Beach.
The walk to the beach is an easy 10 minute walk. Even with carrying beach items, it did not feel like a long walk.
A great feature of this place is the front porch. It is totally shaded and has comfy seating. It's the perfect place to relax, or to eat some take out/delivery if you want to avoid eating inside at a restaurant.
Paul was great with communication. He was able to accommodate my request for an early check in as well as a late check out. Those extra few hours meant for a much more full day in Virginia Beach both on the day we arrived and when we left.
You'll have a lot more space here than at a hotel on the beach that will cost the same (or even more). Plus you get access to two bikes, beach chairs, and that lovely front porch. I cannot imagine you'll regret your choice if you decide to stay here.

Both beds were super comfortable and everything was very clean. Having both the front and back porches was fantastic because if it rains the front porch is covered, and if it's sunny the back porch is a great place to sit and enjoy the weather while looking over the golf course. Paul was a great communicator, left perfect instructions for us, and responded to any and every need we had. He even provided bicycles for us to use while we were there, and gave great dinner recommendations. The location was exactly as described- two short blocks from the beach. I will DEFINITELY stay here again!

Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
We stayed at Janet's place for one night. We went to First Landing State Park and the beach. Both are close to Janet's place. The beach is about a 10-minute walk to the beach—very manageable and easy to navigate.
We were mesmerized by Janet's little garden. A lot of birds frequented it in the morning as well. I'd be happy just sitting there all day without going anywhere.
The place is adjunct to the main house. You'd access it from the backyard, where you'd see all the pretty flowers and plants. The main room has a queen bed whereas the other room with a single bed sits next to the small living room and it doesn't have a door but a curtain for privacy. It didn't bother us at all, though. We heard footsteps early in the morning, which woke us up. But it's no big deal. I wanted to point these out in case you have specific expectations.
Janet provided clear and helpful information. They were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone.

The place was just what we needed ... a well appointed accommodation with a comfortable bed and enough space for our luggage and other belongings. The area around was full of local eateries. We enjoyed walking the 'boardwalk' on the oceanfront. The rip roar of the naval jets was exciting .... (at first). It did get old after over 15 flights, above, during the day ... though ... comes with the territory. I'm glad Scott recommended a hike at First Landing State Park. We hiked there for 3 hours and really enjoyed both the history and the beauty of the place.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Utterly Charming! From the first look at photos and descriptions online to the actual arrival and experience, this sweet, cozy place just kept getting better. Our hosts could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Plenty of thoughtful snacks and hot and cold beverages available. Janet was even so kind as to loan me a treasured keepsake (signed book) when she learned I was an Edgar Cayce Fan. Scott made sure the firepit was functioning and available to keep us toasty on cool Spring evenings. The decor and artwork were outstanding and so charming, I kept waiting for Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs to arrive. Truly as delightful a place as one would find in a Disney fairy tale. One tiny annoyance (not the fault, by any means, of the wonderful, gracious hosts): The location is very near a naval air station, so expect to hear a lot of small planes going in and out. This didn't take away at all from a pretty darn perfect experience. I highly recommend and hope to return.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Your artsy aunt's guesthouse. This quirky little garden retreat has a surprise around every corner. You arrive through a tunnel cut through willow branches, find a small residence with personal touches from hand-painted walls to bead-lined closet entries to clever space maximiers in the kitchen and beyond. You will spend most of your time in the "outdoor living room" topped by a patio that stops most but not all of the rain and over which fly loud yet reassuring Navy jets ("Talk to me, Goose"). This is not a place for people looking for a beige box with stock wall art, or oversized Mediterranean villa with more square footage than taste. If you're looking for a smallish (ok, tiny) artsy-craftsy retreat in a great location adjacent to friendly folks and dogs (hi, Seaweed), this might be the place for you.

They had a fire going in the fire pit when we returned from our evening out with decorative lights in the garden for a super relaxing spot to unwind for the rest of the evening. The fresh tomato’s from their garden were just the little extra touch that made our breakfast a treat before we left. Highly recommended for your stay in VA beach!

review_text: This is a great home- 4 bedroom, 3.5 bath about 4-5 blocks from the boardwalk. It is very walkable to the beach as well as restaurants. The kitchen is well stocked and we felt very safe here. The home is a 3 level home. It was nice to sit outside on the front and back porch when we weren’t at the beach. The beds were comfortable and it was clean. We found extra towels and linens as needed! Plenty of hot water. We had a few hiccups (code didn’t work at check in, wifi was out, couldn’t locate pack n play) but Kara, our host, was quickly responsive and very helpful. She resolved our issues almost immediately! My only con to this house is that it is located right off a busy road (22nd st) so it is very loud when sleeping at night due to sirens and loud engines, but sound machines were helpful. Other than that, would highly recommend!

The best part was the close walk to the beach. Kara was a great host who checked in on us to ensure we had made it in smoothly! I definitely would recommend staying here for your stay in Virginia Beach.

The place looks just like the photos, and though small is extremely well equipped and lovingly furnished. Highlights of our stay included walking around the farm’s extensive trails during the day and enjoying the fire pit in the evening. This place is my Happy Place. Loved seeing Naomi’s shop in town, too. Fantastic wares; even better mission. Thank you for everything!!

We will definitely come back next year with our little daughters, I'm sure they'll enjoy the farm vibes.

review_text: First time traveling long distance with my pup. We were looking for something different. Outdoorsy. I made the reservation a few hours before we hit Cape Charles. Naomi responded and accepted within an hour. We enjoyed the beautiful cabin and trails. We were greeted by Paul and Buddy the farm dog. Buddy and my pup got to roam trails. He was a great addition to our stay he even slept out on the porch to keep an eye on the wildlife. I enjoyed the birds in the pond and the Victrola with great selection of vinyl. The bathroom was clean and hot water was a bonus. This was my first time booking abnb so I learned about cleaning fees and taxes so it was a bit pricey for me but I'm glad I did it we deserved a treat. It's perfect spot to enjoy quiet and listen to nature and the farm animals. Nothing like sitting on a porch with a hot cup of tea in February. I love the simple basic kitchen. Thank you so much. If we ever end up in area I would totally stay again.

The town of Cape Charles is also not to be missed- especially Deadrise Pizza (seriously good). Thank you for a lovely stay- I will definitely be back to such a special spot!

review_text:
We were supposed to only book the airstream but with Naomi’s recommendation we decided to add the cabin too. It was the best decision as we were able to experience both places during our stay, they are walkable so it’s easy to go back and forth. This cabin is facing a pond where the ducks are and watching them is really entertaining. Other farm animals especially the chickens go in this area as well in the morning.
The cabin is small but has a good sized shower area and the bedroom in the 2nd floor doesn’t feel claustrophobic. There’s much sunlight that comes through the cabin which makes it brighter. Paul and Narelle made sure we are comfortable. Buddy the farm dog is the best and most adorable. Location is also about 12-15min drive to restaurants or main street/downtown.
We are coming back for sure! :)

review_text: This was a fantastic little property outside of Cape Charles. It's a tiny home on a lovely little pond in a super cool little farm. The goats, chickens, ducks, turkeys, and the dog Buddy greeted us every morning and evening and we're great hosts. The property is very well kept with a fun maze of trails cut out from the surrounding woods. Buddy will take you on a tour while you're having your morning coffee. It's and easy 10 min drive to the restaurants and shops in cape charles. We're definitely coming back here. Make sure to read the description before booking. It can accommodate a small family but it is a tiny home and the ladder to the loft is steep. But it's very well appointed and super cozy and cute. All and all one of the best Air B and B experiences I have had.

review_text:
My husband and I stayed here for a two nights and were SO impressed. Rarely have we booked an Airbnb that has blown us away - but wow. The farm is adorable, with goats and chickens running around; Buddy the farm dog too. Check in was simple. The cabin was secluded from the rest of the farm and peaceful, with two sweet ducks that we were able to feed from the front deck. The interior is impeccable! And so, so clean. The sheets were comfy. The design of the cabin is well thought out. Tiny details like plugs on both sides of the bed and a light switch by the bed for easy shut-off. Great curtains for privacy when needed. We just loved sitting by candle light at the end of the night in such a cozy/stylish space. Thank you for sharing it :)
Oh we also had our two small dogs with us and they loved it too. No issues at all. They loved saying “hi” to Buddy when he was roaming around.

review_text:
Lovely small cabin with all the amenities I needed in the woods on the peaceful VA Eastern Shore.
Perfect for a one/two person getaway. Loved having my dog with me. Buggy but that’s the area in the summer; bring bug spray. Nice area restaurants, Cape Charles is just ten minutes away. If you are a bike rider or birder this is a great area; hiking trails are sparse, however. Next time I am bringing my kayak.
Lovely hosts, helpful and kind and a friendly menagerie of animals on the farm.

Rating, 4 stars
,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This converted birdwatching loft facing the pond/woods was a pleasant stay with a sense of quiet, peace, and truly wonderful and responsive hosts! We parked our car Thursday evening and didn’t get back in until Sunday, just hung around the property and totally relaxed. Three notes for future guests:
1 - Heads up, we were able to stream a movie without any real issues but the WiFi is a little weak (which is in the house instructions after you reserve). Hopefully you’re not choosing this serene property because you need to work, it would be a waste of a great experience.
2 - The farm dog (Buddy) is SUPER friendly and definitely a working free-roaming dog, which was only a challenge for us because our puppy absolutely would not go to the bathroom with Buddy around for the first 48 hours. The hosts were so understanding and helped coordinate with us so we could get our girl out while Buddy ate.
3 - FYI, if it’s bug season, you’ll have a hard time being outside without lots of bug spray!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My boyfriend and I got engaged two weeks ago and had this vacation booked prior. This cabin was exactly what we needed.
We arrived in Cape Charles early (about 3 hours prior to check-in at 4pm). We messaged Naomi to see if the cabin was ready and if we could arrive earlier. Naomi responded quickly and we were allowed to check in around 10 minutes after our arrival to town. Once getting to the property, we met Buddy who showed us exactly where to go.
We stayed for 5 days and truthfully, I could have stayed longer. Paul and his wife, Narelle, were incredible hosts, and honestly, truly incredible to meet and hear their stories. I would definitely stay here again. BUDDY WAS ONE OF THE BEST PARTS.
Kelly's Pub was amazing! We loved going to the Coffee House for breakfast and lunch. Definitely stop by the shop, Naomi owns -- Voiajer. Dead Rise Pizza was excellent! If you have a chance, visit the Wildlife Refuge for some incredible views.
Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Their dog, Buddy, was a friendly tour guide and led us throughout the trails on the property. The animals provided some pleasant entertainment as we would watch the ducks swim in the pond each night on the back porch. The cabin itself had all that two people would need for a long weekend including a record player, which we greatly appreciated as music lovers. The small details throughout the cabin like candlelights, a rustic mirror, and a vintage-looking microwave all added to the overall atmosphere of the cabin. The hosts were very responsive when we had a small concern and were also very respectful of our privacy. We did have some trouble with the smart lock working but because the cabin was out of the way from the main house, we felt safe and did not feel that this issue needed to be resolved.

There are lots of trails for walking (it rained so it was a bit muddy, so bring shoes that do well in mud) and it was great for walking my dogs around. The place is dog friendly, no pets allowed on furntiure, which we just put our suitcase on the couch so our pups weren't tempted and the dogs are unable to get to the loft area. The people on the farm are so friendly and the farm dog Buddy loved going on our walks with us. He is super friendly and my dogs loved playing with him. I would highly recommed this place to anyone traveling to the area. Its only about 12 minutes from Cape Charles and 11 minutes from the state park.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The setting of this cabin is beautiful. Very private with a lovely water view. Great location a short drive or bike ride to the oceanfront. But without the hubbub of the resort area. Near restaurants and shopping.
The cabin itself is a converted shed or garage. Basically one 18 x 25 foot room and a small bathroom. It was very clean. Melissa, the host, is solicitous and helpful. So there is a lot to like.
An issue to consider is the bed, which is a pull out couch. It was okay for one person for a couple of days. But it isn’t as comfortable as a regular bed. Another issue is the heating/air conditioning unit. It is a window unit directly over the couch/bed and is pretty loud. I turned it off at night.
It is a nice spot and certainly more enjoyable than staying at a typical Virginia Beach hotel.

name: Donald
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Wow! At first it was hard to believe that you actually were as close to the water as it was advertised, but indeed when we made our way down way down to this oasis the deck was but 2 feet from being right on the water! It was a picturesque view from early morning through to dusk and through the dappled light you The cabin face looking up the waterway and could see a meandering lagoon setting with boats docks and ducks. There was a gracious deck with setting to enjoy all of this and it somehow managed to be very private and quaint well still at having all of this surround of you.
The cabin was well appointed with two extremely large windows facing in teo directions both up the water way In front of you with the bed/couch face it. The side window just as large was but a few feet away from the water right there. There points when small fish were jumping etc. and at times I was surprised a place like this even existed!
Coming from Washington DC I was also happy how quiet it was and at times absolutely silent. Yet ironically literally about three minutes away from the main strip with great dining and shopping etc. and the main road lead directly to the beaches.
The owners were respectful and discrete and we did have a chance to speak to both which turned out to be a pleasure. We were treated like family and they continually inquired whether we needed anything and were ready to make our stay as enjoyable in anyway they could.
I’m going back to this solace soon perhaps just for some quiet time to reflect.

name: Grace
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Melissa is a great host and the cottage is cute and clean. We stayed for a weekend and explored Virginia Beach. The cottage is a short drive to everything you want to do in Virginia Beach. The cottage is private and looks right over the creek. The deck is a great space to enjoy the nature. We went on a very rainy weekend and the walk from your car to the cottage can get a little muddy - no problem when wearing shorts and flip flops. We slept in the double pull out couch and it was comfortable. Bedding and linens were all in good condition. The shower was pretty tight, but had good water pressure and was nice and hot. The kitchen was limited to a mini fridge and a microwave - but Melissa recommends so many good dining spots you won’t miss cooking for a weekend. Make sure to hike the first landing state park and go to chicks beach! Fancy drinks at the cavalier were also great!

·
Group trip
review_text:
Andrew was an incredible host. He was very communicative in the days leading up to/the day of our arrival. His instructions and guide were clear, concise, and very helpful.
As for the property - 5 out of 5! Very clean and accessible. I was in VA Beach for the Shamrock Marathon along with a large group (8 of us total), and we were very comfortable. All 4 bedrooms were spacious, and with 3 bathrooms in the house, there were never any issues in that regard.
The location was incredibly convenient. within walking distance of numerous restaurants (we thoroughly enjoyed Repeal as well as Barrel, both great burger spots) and convenience/grocery stores, not to mention two blocks (literally less than 10 min walk) from the boardwalk and beach.
The only concern I had was parking (we had 3 vehicles total), which is slightly limited, but Andrew gave me the heads up as well as a tip/suggested solution should it become an issue (it ultimately worked out fine).
I highly recommend this property!

review_text: Beautiful home and was our home away from home during Christmas. Andrew was awesome and communicated immediately from the first question asked about his property and answered all our questions and made booking easy. The communication continued right through to the end at check-out. The home is spacious with 4 beautiful bedrooms (the beds were amazing and comfortable), and 3 bathrooms that had everything needed including ample tp, body wash and shampoo. We hosted Christmas Eve and Christmas dinner (our son returned home from deployment) for our family and it was all made possible by having a home that was comfortable and beautiful. Our Christmas morning complete with a fireplace! Although the weather was windy we still enjoyed the awesome backyard for some air. The location perfect as it was blocks away from the beach and boardwalk, and all of the stores for any last minute things, like gas and groceries, steps away from a 7-Eleven store too! Awesome home and owner!

Nataly's place was as described - perfect place to stay while in town. It is the top follow of a duplex unit, so you do have to climb up 2 flights of stairs (1/2 utside, and 1-1/2 inside, but that wasn't a deal breaker for us.
Keurig style coffee maker in the room, plenty of coffee was a nice touch. Was pretty peaceful, and Nataly went out of her way to make sure the temps were to our liking when we arrived.
She was also very flexible with our arrival time, and very accomodating.
We would definitely consider staying with her again when in the area.

review_text:
Our stay at Natalys was overall pretty nice. It looks exactly like the pictures and was very clean. Nataly was very responsive to our messages and assisted us when we needed help. She also gave good recommendations and was very friendly when we spoke to her. The one thing that we didn’t like was we were not under the impression that
Nataly lives/is very often at the place of rental. As this was our honeymoon, we frequently saw her when we would have preferred to have been left alone. There was also an occurrence where she rang the doorbell late at night when we were both in bed and had to get out of bed to answer the door. She was also adamant about removing shoes in the door which I could understand if it were summertime and we were tracking in sand but we were not. I also didn’t love the area, there was a nice lake view on the balcony but the neighborhood itself wasn’t the best. Overall, our stay was pretty good at Natalys and the price was very reasonable.

review_text:
Nataly's place was spotless and cozy. It has everything you would get from a hotel and very neat and clean. Also location, location location!! . The area was safe, you are like three blocks away from the beach and several restaurants. The major hotels like Marriott and Holiday Inn which are on the boardwalk are probably a lot more expensive. I recommend Nataly's place in order to save money. I had an easy check in and check out and was never disturbed while staying in her place, her family is also very quiet.
However, my only criticism is that we stayed there two days. On each day we noticed while we were gone that someone came into the room while we were out. Which I did not like because it's an invasion of privacy. I do understand that the room is in her home and not a separate space, however if she had any concerns she should have reached out.

Nataly’s top floor room was the most ideal for us compared to similarly priced hotels. We attended taco fest at the beach, and it was an easy walk. We were able to go straight up to the room which had key access, so basically it’s own apartment. The neighborhood felt very safe at all hours.
The room was immaculate! Not one speck of dust, which is always comforting and appreciated. We enjoyed the balcony overlooking the pond. The screened slider was a nice bonus. The room was stocked with more than the standard toiletries and there was a small fridge, microwave, toaster, and dishes. There was also a Keurig for coffee and tea. The size is perfect for a couple. We only stayed one night but could see ourselves coming back.

bike rentals a must as you can enjoy riding on boardwalk. Doc Taylors is great for eating out, and if your into spanish food, Criollo is a must!

The parking space was a good size, could be a little cramped for bigger cars but our mini van fit perfectly fine. Over all a very good stay.

Location is perfect! Just a 5-10 min walk from the beach! There is a lot of food around but just not quite anything we fully enjoyed. People in the nearby areas such as food places were a little rude as we are Hispanic, we didn’t want to think that was a factor but we could tell it s definitely was as other people were treated differently! Thankfully Nataly was amazing always so quick to reply to any messages sent. Overall this place is amazing would have to definitely recommend and just if your looking for a good place to eat
Beach Bella pizza 2 is just a 3 min drive and the good here is amazing also workers here were very nice.

The apartment was just off the main street and there was very little noise from the traffic and other tourists.
